meanings.definition: A chapel endowed for the singing of Masses for the souls of the founders or of persons named by them.
meanings.sent1: The small chantries in the old church were beautifully decorated.
meanings.sent2: People often visited the chantries to pray for their loved ones.
meanings.sent3: The chantries were so peaceful that even the birds seemed to sing in harmony.
meanings.sent4: The chantries stood like silent guardians, watching over the memories of the departed.
meanings.sent5: The flickering candles in the chantries created a solemn atmosphere.

meanings.definition: An endowment for the singing of Masses for the souls of the founders or of persons named by them.
meanings.sent1: The generous donation was used to establish new chantries in the cathedral.
meanings.sent2: The chantries were funded by the community to honor their ancestors.
meanings.sent3: It was said that the ghosts of the founders danced in the chantries at midnight.
meanings.sent4: The legacy of the donors echoed through the walls of the chantries.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of gratitude filled the chantries during the Masses.
